title: :is()
description: The `:is()` CSS pseudo-class allows for grouping multiple selectors together to apply the same styles to elements that match any of the selectors within the function, increasing specificity.
content: The pseudo-class that matches elements based on a selector list, but it does increase specificity. it's useful for applying styles to elements while also influencing their specificity in the cascade. This pseudo-class helps target specific elements with more precise control over styling hierarchy.
